decision_conditions: An application to fell trees covered by a tree preservation order should be accompanied with evidence showing the need for the tree(s) removal.  This should either be a report showing:
a)	that the tree(s) health or structural condition is so poor that pruning or other works can no longer retain the tree(s) in a safe condition.
b)	That the tree has been proven to be causing structural damage.

This requirement is clearly stated on the TPO application form (Section 8).  As this evidence has not been provided with the application, Ealing Council refuses permission to remove the protected tree(s).
description:
TPO 637:
G1 -Take the group of Sycamore Trees down as they are too close to the flats behind, and they have been badly pruned before. 
G2 -Take down the small group of Sycamore Trees, which are overhanging the main road 
G3 - Take down the group of Sycamore Trees by the main gate.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
